thread.title: easyJet hand luggage restrictions

author: Lizzie Porter
title: easyJet hand luggage restrictions
text: How many pieces of luggage can I bring in the cabin with me? One, free of charge. Size: 50 x 40 x 20cm including wheels and handles to be guaranteed to travel in the cabin, otherwise up to 56cm x 45cm x 25cm. If the flight is very busy, passengers with cases larger than 50 x 40 x 20cm may be asked to put their bag in the hold at the gate. This is free of charge - but means you have to wait at the baggage carousel at the other end. Weight: No limit Can I book a hold bag on a single leg, and travel hand-luggage only on the other? Yes. Related Articles The world’s coolest suitcase? 25 Nov 2014 50 top packing tips 10 Jun 2015 Virgin Atlantic hand luggage restrictions 03 Aug 2015 The suitcase that turns into a chair 13 Oct 2014 Am I allowed any items in addition to my one cabin bag ? EasyJet allows passengers to bring on board an overcoat, shawl, umbrella, crutches or walking frame/stick, and one standard size bag of duty free goods from the departure airport. Anything else? EasyJet says that infants sitting on an adult’s lap do not qualify for free cabin baggage, so any baby items must form part of an adult's cabin baggage. See here for easyJet's baggage policies page .
